title: Encoding: The First Step
description: A short lesson to help you apply Encoding: The First Step.

hook.text: You met someone ten seconds ago and already forgot their name. What happened?

buildup.text: Your brain didn't fail. It never saved the name in the first place.

discovery.text: Encoding is the process of converting experience into a memory trace your neurons can store.

twist.text: Paying attention is the gatekeeper. No attention, no encodingâ€”no matter how important.

climax.text: Deep encoding links new info to things you already know, making it stick.

punchline.text: Memory starts with attention, not repetition.
